text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin Golding

text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V Berard

text: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the universe trying to build bigger and better idiots. So far, the universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

text: I have always wished for my computer to be as easy to use as my telephone; my wish has come true because I can no longer figure out how to use my telephone.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: Computer science education cannot make anybody an expert programmer any more than studying brushes and pigment can make somebody an expert painter.
author: Eric S. Raymond

text: Don’t worry if it doesn’t work right. If everything did, you’d be out of a job.
author: Mosher’s Law of Software Engineering

text: For a long time it puzzled me how something so expensive, so leading edge, could be so useless. And then it occurred to me that a computer is a stupid machine with the ability to do incredibly smart things, while computer programmers are smart people with the ability to do incredibly stupid things. They are, in short, a perfect match.
author: Bill Bryson

text: When someone says: 'I want a programming language in which I need only say what I wish done', give him a lollipop.
author: Alan J. Perlis

text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

text: Perfection [in design] is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: You can’t have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
author: Jim McCarthy

text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
author: Christopher Thompson

text: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

text: People think that computer science is the art of geniuses but the actual reality is the opposite, just many people doing things that build on each other, like a wall of mini stones.
author: Donald Knuth

text: First learn computer science and all the theory. Next develop a programming style. Then forget all that and just hack.
author: George Carrette

text: Most of you are familiar with the virtues of a programmer. There are three, of course: laziness, impatience, and hubris.
author: Larry Wall

text: If you optimize everything, you will always be unhappy.
author: Donald Knuth

text: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
author: Seymour Cray

text: There are two ways of constructing a software design. One way is to make it so simple that there are obviously no deficiencies. And the other way is to make it so complicated that there are no obvious deficiencies.
author: C.A. R. Hoare

text: If you think it's simple, then you have misunderstood the problem.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: It's easy to win forgiveness for being wrong; being right is what gets you into real trouble.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: Programming is not an art, not a science, but a craft.
author: Richard Stallman

text: The overall intent is to make everyone sufficiently happy (or in some cases, insufficiently unhappy).
author: Larry Wall
